lw3dge.graphics

Class Loader

  • java.lang.Object
    • lw3dge.graphics.Loader

  • public class Loader
extends java.lang.Object
    A class 'loaded' ;) with generic data gathering functions. The main functionality of this class is to parse data into a format that is more easily understandable by OpenGL/GLFW. Therefore it is more of a library than a class, however it must actually be an object and must be instantiated because this both uses OpenGL methods that require an active context, and manages a list of VAO, VBO and Texture pointers that MUST be deleted on shutdown (java does not garbage collect these). This class should not be reused for anything fancy, and therefore I will not spend much time detailing these functions with comments.
    Author:
    Jared Massa

      • loadTexture

        public static int loadTexture(java.lang.String fileName)
        Load a texture (.png) from a file
        Parameters:
        fileName - the filename of the .png
        Returns:
        a pointer to the loaded memory

      • loadToVAO

        public RawModel loadToVAO(float[] positions,
                          float[] textureCoords,
                          float[] normals,
                          int[] indices)
        Take data and store it in a VAO. This function will create the VAO, fill it with data, unbind the VAO, store the VAO pointer in a RawModel object, and return the model.
        Parameters:
        positions - the vertex positions of this model
        textureCoords - the texture coordinates of this model
        normals - the normals for each vertex in this model
        indices - the index buffer representing the vertex order and repetition in this model
        Returns:
        the RawModel referencing the generated VAO pointer

      • loadToVAO

        public RawModel loadToVAO(float[] positions)
        Deprecated. until further notice
        Load a VAO for a GUI 2D GUI Element
        Parameters:
        positions - The GUI coordinates
        Returns:
        a VAO for this GUI element

      • cleanUp

        public void cleanUp()
        TO BE CALLED UPON ENGINE SHUTDOWN. Destroys all VAO and VBO references by freeing the memory. This will also free memory to all texture pointers.
